name: Classic Tomato Soup
steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until soft and translucent, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the quartered tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they start to break down.
Pour in the vegetable broth, add dried basil, salt, and pepper.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and let it simmer for 20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth, or carefully transfer it in batches to a regular blender.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Serve hot.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
steps: In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, garam masala, and ginger. Add chicken and toss to coat. Marinate for at least 1 hour.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté the chopped onion until golden brown.
Add the marinated chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Stir in the tomato sauce, reduce heat, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in the heavy cream and cook until the sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
steps: Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
While pasta is cooking, fry the pancetta in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Add the garlic for the last minute of cooking.
In a separate bowl, whisk together egg yolks, Pecorino, and Parmesan. Season generously with black pepper.
Drain the pasta and immediately add it to the skillet with the pancetta. Remove from heat.
Gradually pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot pasta, stirring quickly to create a creamy sauce. Add reserved pasta water a little at a time if the sauce is too thick.
Serve immediately with an extra sprinkle of cheese and pepper.

name: Vegan Chana Masala
steps: Heat coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion until soft.
Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 more minute until fragrant.
Stir in cumin, coriander, and turmeric. Cook for 30 seconds.
Add the crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the chickpeas and garam masala. Simmer for another 10-15 minutes.
Stir in lemon juice and serve hot with rice.

name: Classic Guacamole
steps: Cut the avocados in half, remove the pits, and scoop the flesh into a medium bowl.
Mash the avocado with a fork to your desired consistency.
Add the chopped red onion, jalapeño, and cilantro to the bowl.
Squeeze the lime juice over the mixture and sprinkle with salt.
Stir everything together until well combined.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips.

name: Beef Stir-Fry
steps: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, and cornstarch. Add the sliced steak and marinate for 15 minutes.
Heat sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Remove steak from marinade and stir-fry until browned. Remove from skillet.
Add broccoli and bell pepper to the skillet and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.
Return the steak to the skillet along with any remaining marinade. Cook for 1-2 minutes until the sauce has thickened.
Stir in the scallions and serve immediately.

name: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch the spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes, then transfer to ice water. Drain and blend to a smooth puree.
Heat ghee in a pan and lightly fry the paneer cubes until golden. Set aside.
In the same pan, add more ghee if needed, and sauté the onion until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, and cook for a minute.
Add the tomato puree, coriander, and turmeric. Cook until the oil separates.
Stir in the spinach puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the fried paneer cubes, garam masala, and heavy cream. Simmer for 2 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or roti.

name: Lemon Herb Baked Salmon
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat the salmon fillets dry and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix together olive oil, minced garlic, oregano, thyme, lemon juice, and zest.
Brush the mixture evenly over the salmon fillets. Season with salt and pepper.
Top each fillet with a few lemon slices.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve immediately.

name: Mushroom Risotto
steps: In a large saucepan, heat olive oil and sauté the mushrooms until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same saucepan, add the shallot and cook until soft. Add the Arborio rice and toast for 1 minute.
Pour in the white wine and cook until it's fully absorbed, stirring constantly.
Add the hot vegetable broth one ladle at a time, allowing each ladle to be absorbed before adding the next. Continue stirring for about 18-20 minutes.
Once the rice is creamy and al dente, stir in the cooked mushrooms, Parmesan cheese, and butter.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with parsley, and serve.

name: Black Bean Burgers
steps: In a bowl, combine the mashed black beans, breadcrumbs, onion, beaten egg, cumin, and chili powder. Mix well.
Shape the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties.
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook the patties for 4-5 minutes on each side, until golden brown and firm.
Serve on burger buns with your favorite toppings.

name: Quinoa Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
steps: Cook quinoa in water according to package directions. Let it cool completely.
In a large bowl, combine the cooled quinoa, cucumber, red bell pepper, feta cheese, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, and Dijon mustard to make the vinaigrette.
Pour the vinaigrette over the quinoa salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Pad Thai
steps: Cook rice noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together fish sauce, brown sugar, tamarind, and soy sauce.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add shrimp and garlic, and stir-fry until shrimp is pink.
Push shrimp to one side of the wok. Pour the egg into the other side and scramble.
Add the cooked noodles and the sauce to the wok. Toss everything to combine.
Stir in the bean sprouts and cook for 1 more minute.
Serve immediately, topped with crushed peanuts and a lime wedge.

name: Lentil Soup
steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add onion, carrots, and celery and cook until softened.
Stir in the rinsed lentils.
Pour in the vegetable broth, add thyme and a bay leaf.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 45-50 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Remove the bay leaf before serving.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Caesar Salad
steps: In a small bowl, whisk together all the dressing ingredients until smooth.
In a large salad bowl, combine the chopped romaine lettuce and croutons.
Pour the dressing over the lettuce and toss to coat evenly.
Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

name: Classic Pancakes
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles appear on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve warm with syrup and butter.

name: Garlic Shrimp Scampi
steps: Cook linguine according to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water.
While pasta cooks, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes until pink.
Pour in the white wine and lemon juice, and bring to a simmer.
Add the drained linguine to the skillet. Toss with the sauce, adding pasta water if needed to create a smooth sauce.
Stir in the parsley and serve immediately.

name: Roasted Chicken and Vegetables
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a large bowl, toss potatoes, carrots, and onion with 2 tbsp of olive oil, rosemary, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Spread the vegetables in a single layer in a large roasting pan.
Pat the chicken dry. Rub the remaining 2 tbsp of olive oil all over the chicken and season generously with salt and pepper.
Place the chicken on top of the vegetables in the roasting pan.
Roast for 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.
Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving.

name: Aloo Gobi
steps: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add the onion and sauté until golden.
Stir in the ginger-garlic paste and cook for one minute.
Add the potatoes, cauliflower, turmeric, coriander, and chili powder. Mix well.
Cover and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the chopped tomato, cover again, and cook for another 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.

name: French Onion Soup
steps: Melt butter in a large pot over medium-low heat. Add the sliced onions and cook slowly for 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until deeply caramelized.
Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Deglaze the pot by pouring in the white wine and scraping up any browned bits.
Stir in the beef broth, thyme, and bay leaf. Bring to a simmer and cook for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the broiler. Ladle the soup into oven-safe bowls.
Top each bowl with a slice of toasted baguette and a generous amount of Gruyère cheese.
Place the bowls under the broiler for 2-3 minutes, until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
Serve immediately.

name: Caprese Salad
steps: Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a platter, alternating them.
Tuck the fresh basil leaves in between the slices.
Drizzle the balsamic glaze and olive oil over the top.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately as a refreshing appetizer or side dish.

name: Thai Green Curry
steps: Scoop the thick cream from the top of the coconut milk can into a wok or pot over medium heat. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the oil separates.
Stir in the green curry paste and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the chicken slices and cook until no longer pink.
Pour in the remaining coconut milk. Bring to a simmer.
Add the red bell pepper and bamboo shoots. Cook for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Stir in the fish sauce, brown sugar, and basil leaves.
Serve hot with jasmine rice.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
Let cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

name: Greek Salad
steps: In a large salad bowl, combine the lettuce, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion.
Gently toss in the kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese.
In a small jar, shake together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, and oregano to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately.

name: Avocado Toast
steps: Toast the slices of bread to your desired level of crispness.
While the bread is toasting, mash the avocado in a small bowl with the lemon juice.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly on the toasted bread.
Sprinkle with red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.
Serve immediately for a quick and healthy breakfast or snack.

name: Shepherd's Pie
steps: Boil the potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain, then mash with milk and butter until smooth. Season and set aside.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large skillet, brown the ground lamb. Drain excess fat.
Add the onion and carrots and cook until softened.
Stir in the flour and cook for one minute. Gradually whisk in the beef broth and tomato paste.
Bring to a simmer and cook until the sauce has thickened. Stir in the frozen peas.
Pour the meat filling into a baking dish. Spread the mashed potatoes evenly over the top.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.

name: Butternut Squash Soup
steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add onion and cook until soft.
Add the butternut squash and apple to the pot. Cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in the vegetable broth and add the cinnamon and nutmeg.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the squash is very tender.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve warm.

name: Chicken Fajitas
steps: In a large bowl, toss the sliced chicken with the fajita seasoning.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet or cast iron pan over medium-high heat.
Add the seasoned chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove from skillet.
Add the sliced onions and bell peppers to the skillet and cook until softened and slightly charred.
Return the chicken to the skillet and toss everything together.
Warm the tortillas and serve immediately with the chicken and vegetable mixture.

name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a small bowl, combine the chopped spinach, feta cheese, and minced garlic.
Cut a pocket into the thickest side of each chicken breast.
Stuff each chicken breast with the spinach and feta mixture. Secure with toothpicks if necessary.
Season the outside of the chicken with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.

name: Teriyaki Glazed Tofu
steps: In a small saucepan, combine soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, and ginger. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens. Set aside.
In a bowl, toss the cubed tofu with cornstarch until evenly coated.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the tofu and cook, turning occasionally, until golden brown and crispy on all sides.
Pour the teriyaki glaze over the crispy tofu and toss to coat.
Serve immediately with steamed rice and broccoli.

name: Classic Chili
steps: In a large pot or Dutch oven, brown the ground beef with the chopped onion over medium heat. Drain excess fat.
Stir in the minced garlic and cook for one minute.
Add the crushed tomatoes, kidney beans, pinto beans, chili powder, cumin, and oregano.
Stir everything together and bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and let it cook for at least 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with toppings like cheese, sour cream, and onions.
